metadata.title: CVE-2016-1687 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The renderer implementation in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.63 does notproperly restrict public exposure of classes, which allows remote attackersto obtain sensitive information via vectors related to extensions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1687` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242').
